result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy M Quinn

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Jeremy M Quinn in court.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Jeremy M Quinn.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:38 AM Defendant Jeremy M Quinn in court.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Investigator Matthews is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an investigator for the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to a vehicle being at an excess speed and conducting a traffic stop. Testifies to Jeremy Quinn being the driver. Witness identifies the defendant (Jeremy Quinn)  in court, court recognizes. Testifies to who the passengers were in the vehicle. Witness identifies Alexis Katzenberger in court, court recognizes. Testifies to conducting an Act 79 search. Testifies to paraphernalia Jeremy stated that he had on him. Testifies to finding a purse that had identifiers of Alexis and the substance that was found in it. Witness testifies to the substances being tests and the results.  

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.

Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy M Quinn in court.
